announcement_collection.title: PRESENTATION SCHEDULE

announcement_collection.body:
Here is some information about the class of Sept 17th as well as some other stuff (sending this as email and posting to Piazza and Sakai):

  • Since yesterday was technically not a required class, there was no attendance taken but I did record a lecture to be watched at your leisure.  You can find it on Panopto in the 2018 Fall :: ECE 564 :: Course Recordings folder.  I won't repeat this lecture, so please watch as it gives an overview of some of the sample code I placed out on GitLab.
  • I moved HW3 Due Date out to Monday morning.
  • On Wed Sept 19th we will talk about how we are doing on Teams and Projects.  This is still due next week so I want to make sure you all are making progress.
  • Due to popular demand, I have moved all the recorded lectures out to the Panopto folder and will do so through the homework sections.
announcement_collection.title: Info about the Sept 17 class and Panopto
announcement_collection.entityTitle: Info about the Sept 17 class and Panopto

announcement_collection.body:
1. Get your textbooks (iOS 11 version).  The text is optional but recommended.
  2. Get the Swift Programming Language 4  from iBooks (it is free download)
  3. You will get an email to sign up for your Apple Developer ID - make sure you use your SHORT (netid) duke id to sign up.
  4. Get your laptop (from me if you don't have one) and download Xcode 9.4.1
  5. Log into gitlab.oit.duke.edu using Shibboleth so you will be a valid GitLab user.  I also suggest creating a GitLab userid and password while you are in there.
  6. Activate your Piazza account if you have not already, make sure you can access from Sakai
announcement_collection.title: Things to do to prepare for class
